dialog.text: That is true. Sometimes, people are too hard on themselves. I think the trick is to just be yourself.
beam_texts: That is true. Sometimes, people are too hard on themselves. I think the trick is to just be yourself.

This is very true. I'm learning to live with myself instead of others because I want to be happy.
I completely agree with you.  It's a two way street.  I guess it can be kind of boring meeting new people.
People make assumptions about you but there's nothing you can do about them until you make them proud of you.
That's true, you just have to follow what they're telling you I guess.  I do that to
I feel like I try to always make a point of doing things the right way and so I always try to impress people. I can be really annoying at times.

oh, I do not like being in that position either. I just ask for something different. I am a soccer mom so I do need to be in the right kind of mindset.

beam_texts: Yes, exactly! So why don't you try and be yourself more often? Don't you find that it's so much fun?

Yeah, I agree. You can tell they're not genuine. It takes more confidence and confidence in yourself to realize you can't do everything someone else can.

But that can be hard sometimes because of social anxiety, which makes it hard to really be yourself without people in the right way giving you reasons to not feel comfortable.

dialog.text: You can say this, "I like you, but I'm not into you." I bet there's someone out there who feels the same way.
beam_texts: You can say this, "I like you, but I'm not into you." I bet there's someone out there who feels the same way.
It can be hard sometimes. But I've found that just fake it until you make it and try not to feel bad about it. A lot of people are like that!

Have you ever tried any therapy to help with that? A lot of people feel like that, but I donr think it's too bad, you should still be yourself!
Why do they want to be with you? I get you, maybe because you're so self conscious of how you look that everyone around you gets uncomfortable.

I get you. Sometimes it can be difficult to break out of that inner circle. But just keep your head up and try to think that you have the best and most genuine conversations, and you'll get through it!

dialog.text: I'm sure there is. I need to be a little more confident about it. Maybe one day.
beam_texts: I'm sure there is. I need to be a little more confident about it. Maybe one day.

That is a good idea. I'm just really introverted and need time to myself sometimes.
Yeah, I guess that's true! It's hard for me to have confidence in myself, though. It's probably something that I'll get over in time.

dialog.text: It will be hard, but you'll get there! Just be yourself and you'll meet the right person!
beam_texts: It will be hard, but you'll get there! Just be yourself and you'll meet the right person!

Just keep your head up, and realize that you'll find someone who makes you happy too. So don't give up!
Don't let it define you, though. Everybody's different and they have to find someone who makes them happy.
Maybe so. You seem really eager to please people, and you should definitely be confident in yourself.
Well, do you think there's anyone who would like to have you around? A friend or boyfriend might be someone who's cool to hang out with.
I'm confident in you. :) Try to surround yourself with a small group of friends that you can keep the nerves under control. I bet they'll make you feel more comfortable.
I'm a very confident person. I find it hard to let people down. I would say start out with strangers and see if they accept you for who you are.
Keep trying! That will pay off when you find the right person. The key is to be genuine and, if they're, it should be enough to make them love you.

beam_texts: Yeah, I feel the same way. My romantic experiences have ended poorly so I wish I was more serious.

dialog.text: I'm sorry to hear that! Romance isn't for everyone. I prefer being alone, that's why I'm single.
beam_texts: I'm sorry to hear that! Romance isn't for everyone. I prefer being alone, that's why I'm single.

Have you tried dating apps? It might help. I'm in an open relationship so I meet lots of nice people!
Yeah. I'm sorry you went through that. I think the only advice I can give is to be patient with the right person!
I'm sorry. Romance is hard. I hope you'll find someone someday. There are more people out there who can understand how you feel.

dialog.text: Oh, yeah, I have no problem with being alone sometimes. What's your favorite food?
beam_texts: Oh, yeah, I have no problem with being alone sometimes. What's your favorite food?

My friends are starting to try and "follow" me when I'm not looking. Its really a double edged sword.
Well, I am better off being single, its a nice feeling to enjoy your own company. I have never been married but sometimes its good to not have someone holding you.

dialog.text: Yes, they are my world.  Do you have any memories with your grandparent?
beam_texts: Yes, they are my world.  Do you have any memories with your grandparent?
Somewhat. I used a canoe to help my grandmother get around because of my physical impairments.
I did not spend a lot of time with them. They passed when I was young. My grandchidren helped me out a lot as a kid.
I always loved taking care of them and helping them out. I don't see them often anymore unfortunately.
Yes. They were really nice, and now I am getting older and I miss them.  Where are you from?
I was an only child. I could use some time with them though. Maybe one day I will have kids so I can spend more time with the grandkids.
My grandparent and I were quite close. It's a lot harder now with all the sickness and stuff.
Yeah, but I also did a lot of hiking with my friends, and helping out my grandpa and grandma with various things.
They lived in the same area so we would go there all the time.  You can do the same with your own kids
yes, it was nice and relaxing.  We did just about anything with them, because my grandmother was 84.

dialog.text: Yes, we all used to help my grandmother when she was sick. It was very rewarding.
beam_texts: Yes, we all used to help my grandmother when she was sick. It was very rewarding.
I do. We always had a great time doing whatever we needed to do around the house.
None that I can remember. They all passed away before I was born. Do you?  Mine were great people.
Yes. My mom used to cook for them all the time.  How about you? Do you do anything to take care of your family?
I do, but she passed away awhile ago.  But I have lots of pictures of her to look at.
I do, I have many memories of them.  They love having me over for Christmas.
Yes, my grandmother has always been my favorite.  I wish she was here more to enjoy life.
Yes, I do. My grandmother died a few years ago, but I'm sure I'll have those memories of her cuddling up next to me when I go home.
I have many memories. It's very upsetting when they die. I don't remember much about them now though.
No, it was all over for us.  They moved far away from us and my parents aren't doing so well.  But we have memories together.

dialog.text: That's great.  My grandparent took care of my grandfather when he was ill as well.  I miss that time when I was young.
beam_texts: That's great.  My grandparent took care of my grandfather when he was ill as well.  I miss that time when I was young.
It's always great when you can help someone out when they're in need.  We need more people like you.  What other nice things did you do to help your grandmom?
Yeah, I helped my grandfather when he was having trouble getting around too.  Did she use anything special to help?
It sure is.  I miss the good old days.  My grandmothe never let go.  How old are you now?
That is wonderful.  I did the same.  Now I can help my nieces and nephews with their chores as well.  You know, because they need it and I know it is appreciated.  What do you do for work?
It really is.  Everyone should give back to our past in that way.  I bet you're proud of what you did as well.
I can imagine!   Were you and your grandma close?  It seems like they would be.  Did you have other grandkids,  or did she pass away?
That sounds very sweet.  I'm glad you enjoyed your time with them.  People often don't appreciate the help they have when it comes to a situation like that.  It's good that you had that time.

It's definitely rewarding to help others who are unable to get around or care for themselves.  Grandparents are so elderly, and I have a few people I get along well with that I try to help them whenever I can.  What are your grandchilren like?

My grandparent's weren't so great at helping with housework, but they were amazing parents in other ways.  They helped my parents in their businesses.  I did help when my mother had surgery.  How were your grandmama's?

dialog.text: I'm so glad to hear you had such a great grandparent to care for you when you were young.
beam_texts: I'm so glad to hear you had such a great grandparent to care for you when you were young.
It's always nice to remember the good memories. I wish my grandchristmas could have taken care of me when I needed it.
I miss those times too. It's a blessing when you have family that loves you.
I'm sorry to hear that. How long ago did he pass away?  I wish they could always visit.
I'm sure he was very thankful for his grandfamily. Do you happen to know what happened to him?
That was very nice of your grandpa. I don't think anyone in my family took care for their elders in this way.
Me too. I miss those days so much. They were great people. It is so nice to have someone in your family that can take care of your grandchilids.
Yes, I loved helping them. They were so passionate about it. They really made me feel complete.
That's sweet. Being old doesn't mean we can't help other people like that. Some people just aren't ready or willing to take responsibility.
What's your grandfarther like?  Mine was an older lady so she was very cool and she always got me the cool candy/sausages.

dialog.text: That is very kind of you to say.  What happened to your grandfarther?  Did he pass away recently?
beam_texts: That is very kind of you to say.  What happened to your grandfarther?  Did he pass away recently?
Thank you.  It was a great privilege to have him around.  Have you ever had any siblings?
Thanks, I appreciate that.  What about you?  Are you close to any family?  Or just work?
I really did, but I will always treasure the times I had with them.  Did you have good relationships with your parents?
Thanks!  They were great. Grandparents are so great to take care of their loved ones.
Thanks.  It really was a privilege for all of us.  Sometimes, I really miss him now, though.
Yeah, I miss my grandpa and dad a lot.  They were great people.  We were always really close.  It was great.
Yeah, we had a lot of fun together.  When you're young you're so keen on something, it's hard to move on.
Yeah, my dad was very involved with the children, which is great. He did volunteer work when he could as well!
I was in a special program at my school where we taught specialized topics about healthcare.  That was really rewarding as well

dialog.text: Yes, he passed away several years ago. He was pretty sick for a long time.  His death was unexpected.
beam_texts: Yes, he passed away several years ago. He was pretty sick for a long time.  His death was unexpected.
He was deceased from a sudden heart attack. He was 84.  That was a long time ago.
He passed away in 2011, after being diagnosed with liver cancer.  RIP to you as well, friend.
He passed away when I had my son, 8 years ago.  We still call him Grandpa and spoil him.
My grandmomma passed away several years ago.  It was hard for me because I was only 10.  But she was a true legend.
No, he was around for awhile. He was the youngest grandparent, so we always spent time with him and loved him. He passed away almost 4 years ago.
He passed away in 2011. He had a very hard time afterwards, but my family made it through the storm okay.
No, but the last time I was with him was almost 15 years ago. My mom took over when he died. It's hard sometimes.
He had heart surgery last year, and was not well for several years after that.  It was so hard being his only grandparent.

He passed away several years ago.  He was an old man and I remember that he really liked photography.  The only thing that stopped him from enjoying it was that he had a heart condition and lost a bunch of his balance.  It was a long time ago though and it was very painful for him.

dialog.text: I'm sorry for your loss.  Did you have a lot of good memories of him?
beam_texts: I'm sorry for your loss.  Did you have a lot of good memories of him?
Sorry to hear that.  Death is never easy, no matter how long ago it was.
That's terrible, I am so sorry for your loss.  Was he in a car accident?
I'm sorry to hear that.  Were you close to him?  What do you do to fill your void?
I'm sorry to hear that.  That must be so hard on your family.  It must be difficult seeing him suffering.
My condolences for your loss.  How old was he?  Was he well off and happy with his life?
It is so hard when they go.  They never know how much they will miss them.  It is an unexplainable feeling.
You're absolutely right.  Death is never truly expected, but it does happen anyway.  It's a sad thing, for sure.
It is always a sad moment when a family member goes.  Can you imagine what you would have done if you had had to watch him go?
I'm sorry to hear that.  There is a lot of tragedy in life that goes on and the family members are truly hard to deal with.

dialog.text: Well, yes I had many memories with him.  He was always there for me when I needed him.
beam_texts: Well, yes I had many memories with him.  He was always there for me when I needed him.
Yes, I still do. We went to church together every sunday, and he would always be there for me when I needed him.
I did, we were really close. He went away when I graduated from college a few years ago, and I'm still very close with him.
Yes, it was a very difficult time for me, but my whole family were supportive.
Thank you. I actually had a lot. He raised me alone since my father passed away when I started middle school. He taught me how to drive.
Thank you. It is good to remember the good times.  He was a great uncle and cared for all of us children.
Not really.  He never really spoke much of a conversation, but he did love to listen to me whistle.  How about yourself?
Yes, I think I had the most genuine, honest relationship with him.  He always had his heart in the right place.
Yes I did.  He taught me all the important lessons I needed in life, especially when I turned 14 and took on the responsibility of taking care of him.
I did. He used to love to give me "uncle-grandfather" hugs whenever he saw me.

dialog.text: That is wonderful.  We need more people like that in the world. I'm glad you still have great memories of your grandpa.
beam_texts: That is wonderful.  We need more people like that in the world. I'm glad you still have great memories of your grandpa.
That is so nice.  How long were you guys together?  and how long did you know him?
Very nice!  I am glad you had great memories of your grandpa.  They are so important.
That's such a wonderful thing.  It's incredible how many people don't have a great relationship with their family.  Your grandfathered was a great person.
I am glad to know he was there for you in such a special way.  Some people never realize how important their loved ones are.
Aww that is so sweet.  It makes me want to go play with my two dogs right now
That's beautiful.  We all need that.  Is he no longer with us?  It must be so hard to lose someone you loved that close.
That's wonderful.  Having someone to rely on and to share joy with can really change your life.
I'm very sorry to hear that he passed.  Life is no fun if you can't be with loved ones.  That sounds like he was a really special person.
That's so nice.  It sounds like he was a very special person.  At least, he's rested and loved in a way that we all share.
